properties.ariaLabel: xsd for the vat return for reverse tax liability permalink

children.value: XSD for the VAT return for reverse tax liability
Initial version of documentation for VAT return for reverse tax liability

properties.ariaLabel: change in the code list for as a consequence of the vat return for reverse tax liability permalink

children.value: Change in the code list for as a consequence of the VAT return for reverse tax liability
In the code list for remarks (merknad.xml) and SAFT-T (mvaKodeSAFT.xml) the following has been added:
These additions shal be used to decide if the code pertains to reverse liability.

Notice that when the ERP suppliers start using the new version of the code list they will have to adapt to these code list additions.
Codes will then be chosen based on whether or not the code has the code addition (kodetillegg) omvendtAvgiftsplikt=SANN, kompensasjon=SANN or alminneligPrimær=SANN.

properties.ariaLabel: version 10 of the xsd for vat return for reverse tax liability permalink

children.value: Version 1.0 of the XSD for VAT return for reverse tax liability

VAT return for reverse tax liability must be submitted in XML-format. It must be in accordance with the structure outlined for the VAT-return. The same XSD applies for all returns.
Version 1.0 of this XSD is found here
Graphical representation of the XSD and encoding for the
VAT return for reverse tax liability
Example files for VAT return for reverse tax liability in XML format can be downloaded

properties.ariaLabel: description of the fields in the vat return for reverse tax liability permalink

children.value: Description of the fields in the VAT return for reverse tax liability

properties.ariaLabel: mva melding for omvendt avgiftsplikt vat return for reverse tax liability permalink

children.value: Mva-melding for omvendt avgiftsplikt (VAT return for reverse tax liability)
Purpose: to ensure that the user can fulfill their VAT reporting obligations
Additional information about the content of the  VAT return for reverse tax liability
Purpose: to ensure that the taxpayer have the possibility to explain their application of law when necessary
Unique identifier for the taxable organisation
Purpose: to take care of the rights and obligations of the taxpayer
The taxpayers unique reference for the submission
Purpose: To ensure that the taxpayer and the tax office refer to the same return.
Name and possible version of accounting system
Purpose: To be able to follow up systematic errors with the system supplier instead of following up each individual taxpayer.
KID is only applicable if the business is to get VAT back from the Tax Authority.
The recipient's identification of a payment
Purpose: To be able to pay to the bank accounts that require KID

properties.ariaLabel: skattegrunnlag og beregnet skatt tax basis and calculated tax permalink

children.value: Skattegrunnlag og beregnet skatt (Tax basis and calculated tax)
The taxation period for which the  VAT return for reverse tax liability applies

Period is stated in accordance with the code list for the Skattleggingsperiode. 
For the VAT return for reverse tax liability quarterly period applies.
Purpose: to ensure consistency between bookkeeping and VAT return period
Sum to pay / sum to be refunded
Purpose: to ensure that the correct amount is being paid
Classification of incoming and outgoing VAT in accordance with the Norwegian SAF-T standard
Purpose: dissemination of which VAT assessments have been carried out
Detailing some VAT conditions that are not included in the Norwegian SAF-T standard
Purpose: dissemination of which VAT assessments have been carried out

Internal VAT code in the accounting system. There may be several internal VAT codes for a mvaKode and possibly a specification. In that case, there will be several lines in the VAT return for reverse tax liability per mvaKode and specification; one per combination of VAT code, specification and VAT CodeAccounting system.
Users: recognizable in relation to what they see in the accounting system.
The system suppliers will not have to change VAT codes in the systems
The amount of which VAT is calculated.
Purpose: Basis for control from the Tax Administration
The VAT rate used in calculating VAT.
Purpose: To ensure that only valid rates are used for calculating VAT
Purpose: to show calculated VAT per line
Information about the content of mvaKode
Purpose: to ensure that the taxpayer can explain his own application of the law where necessary

properties.ariaLabel: description of the fields in the vat return for reverse tax liability submission permalink

children.value: Description of the fields in the VAT return for reverse tax liability submission
The subtype of the form which is submitted
Purpose: to ensure that the user can fulfill their VAT reporting obligations
A VAT return with meldingskategori alminnelig, primær and omvendtAvgiftsplikt will always be
Purpose: The field is kept so at a later date it can be opened for auditors to comment/write notes on returns (e.g. VAT compensation) that should be approved by an auditor before submission.
This field will be removed since we get the required information from the events on the instance.
This will be done by making the field optional in a transition and removed at a appropriate time.
This field should contain the name of the logged in user.
Purpose: The content of this field will be displayed in Altinn.
This field will be removed since we get the required information from the events on the instance.
This will be done by making the field optional in a transition and removed at a appropriate time.
Unique identifier for the taxable organisation
Purpose: to take care of the rights and obligations of the taxpayer
Unique identifier for the taxable organisation
Purpose: to take care of the rights and obligations of the taxpayer
The taxation period for which the  VAT return for reverse tax liability applies

Period is stated in accordance with the code list for the Skattleggingsperiode. 
For the  VAT return for reverse tax liability quarterly period applies.
Purpose: to ensure consistency between book keeping and VAT return period.
The taxation year for which the  return applies
Purpose: to ensure consistency between book keeping and VAT return period.

Type of attachments which is uploaded to the instance on Altinn.
        Where you can either use
for the tax return for VAT return for reverse tax liability , or
Which group the submission comes from.
This field should contain the name of the logged in user.
Purpose: The content of this field will be displayed in Altinn.
This field will be removed since we get the required information from the events on the instance.
This will be done by making the field optional in a transition and removed at a appropriate time.
Name of the file which is uploaded as attachment
The file extension for the file which is uploaded as attachment
Description of the contents of the file which is uploaded as attachment
Purchases of goods from abroad without deduction (standard rate)
Purchases of goods from abroad without deduction (low rate)
Purchases of emission allowances and gold without deduction
Purchases of services from abroad with compensation for VAT (standard rate)
Purchases of services from abroad with compensation for VAT (low rate)
Purchases of emission allowances and gold with compensation for VAT (standard rate)
Encoding for remarks and corresponding VAT code:
The submission of the VAT return requires an XML file containg metadata. This file must be according to the XSD for submission.
XSD for validation documents the structure of the response from the validation service. The feedback will also be according to this XSD.
